      • setCapacity

        public void setCapacity(long capacity)
        Description copied from interface: MemoryUnit
        Updates the capacity (in number of Simulator.BYTEs) of this MemoryUnit.

        The capacity difference is added or subtracted to/from the free capacity of this unit.

        A NotificationCodes.MU_CAPACITY_CHANGED notification is thrown.

        Specified by:
        setCapacity in interface MemoryUnit<Zone extends MemoryZone>
        Overrides:
        setCapacity in class MemoryUnitImpl<Zone extends MemoryZone>

      • isCapacityReserved

        public boolean isCapacityReserved()
        Description copied from interface: VirtualMemoryUnit
        Returns true if the capacity of this virtual memory unit is reserved.

        Default value is false.

        Specified by:
        isCapacityReserved in interface VirtualMemoryUnit<Zone extends MemoryZone,Unit extends MemoryUnit<Zone>>
        Returns:
        true if the capacity of this virtual memory unit is reserved
        See Also:
        VirtualMemoryUnit.setIsCapacityReserved(boolean)

      • setIsCapacityReserved

        public void setIsCapacityReserved(boolean v)
        Description copied from interface: VirtualMemoryUnit
        Updates the isCapacityReserved flag of this virtual memory unit.

        When true, this virtual memory unit's capacity is fully allocated on parent memory unit even if its size (see MemoryZone.getSize()) is smaller.

        When false, only the size of this virtual memory unit is allocated on parent memory unit. This is the default behavior.

        Specified by:
        setIsCapacityReserved in interface VirtualMemoryUnit<Zone extends MemoryZone,Unit extends MemoryUnit<Zone>>

      • setSize

        public void setSize(long newSize)
        Description copied from interface: MemoryZone
        Updates the size (in number of Simulator.BYTEs) of this zone and allocates/frees the difference in the parent memory unit.

        Throws a NotificationCodes.MZ_SIZE_CHANGED notification.

        Specified by:
        setSize in interface MemoryZone
        Parameters:
        newSize - new size of the zone

      • getRealFreeCapacity

        public long getRealFreeCapacity()
        Description copied from interface: VirtualMemoryUnit
        Returns real free capacity that can be allocated.

        Use this method to get real free capacity on this virtual memory unit, when considering parent unit capacity.
        Because the capacity of a virtual memory unit may not be immediately reserved, MemoryUnit.getFreeCapacity() may return a greater value.

        Specified by:
        getRealFreeCapacity in interface VirtualMemoryUnit<Zone extends MemoryZone,Unit extends MemoryUnit<Zone>>
        Returns:
        real free capacity that can be allocated

      • getMetaData

        public MetaData getMetaData()
        Description copied from interface: MemoryZone
        Returns a MetaData object representing the meta-data associated to this memory zone.

        This object may contain for example a filename, a file version_id, modification/creation dates etc.. It is left to the user discretion to choose which meta-data is important and should be saved for the simulation.

        Specified by:
        getMetaData in interface MemoryZone
        Returns:
        a MetaData object representing the meta-data associated to this memory zone

      • setMetaData

        public void setMetaData(MetaData metaData)
        Description copied from interface: MemoryZone
        Updates the meta-data associated with the current zone.
        A NotificationCodes.MZ_METADATA_CHANGED notification is also thrown.
        Specified by:
        setMetaData in interface MemoryZone

      • isReplicaOf

        public boolean isReplicaOf(MemoryZone zone)
        Description copied from interface: MemoryZone
        Returns true if the given zone is the current zone or if it is a replica of the current zone.

        This method may be used, for instance, after migrations to find a replica for a particular memory zone in the new MemoryUnits of the new host.

        Default implementations uses MemoryZone.getMetaData() to check if the two zones contains the same data:

        this.getMetaData().isSameData(zone.getMetaData());
        A special case if one of the meta-data is null, is to return false.
        Specified by:
        isReplicaOf in interface MemoryZone
        Returns:
        true if the given zone is the current zone or if it is a replica of the current zone

      • getMemoryMap

        public Bitmap getMemoryMap(Object id)
        Description copied from interface: MemoryZone
        Returns the user defined memory map with the given id.

        If none is set, then a new one is created such that it marks all the memory as dirty.

        Specified by:
        getMemoryMap in interface MemoryZone
        Returns:
        the user defined memory map with the given id

      • removeMemoryMap

        public void removeMemoryMap(Object id)
        Description copied from interface: MemoryZone
        Removes the memory map that matches the given id.
        Specified by:
        removeMemoryMap in interface MemoryZone

      • modify

        public void modify(long pos,
          long size)
        Description copied from interface: MemoryZone
        Call this method to mark as modified the delimited area in this zone by pos (inclusive) and pos+size (exclusive).

        After calling this, all the memory maps inside of this memory zone are updated accordingly (the delimited memory is marked as dirty).
        Also, the MetaData related to this MemoryZone is updated accordingly (the zone's version is updated).

        A NotificationCodes.MZ_MODIFIED notification is also thrown.

        Specified by:
        modify in interface MemoryZone
        Parameters:
        pos - the position from which the modification starts
        size - the count of bytes that were modified (starting from pos)

      • supportsFailureStateUpdate

        public boolean supportsFailureStateUpdate()
        Description copied from interface: FailureProneEntity
        Returns true if the FailureProneEntity.FailureState of this entity can be modified. Note that even if a entity implements the FailureProneEntity interface, it does not mean it supports state changing.
        Thus you have to check the return value of this method to ensure that you can use FailureProneEntity.setFailureState(FailureState) safely.

        If this method returns false and you try to change the FailureProneEntity.FailureState of this entity you will get a UnsupportedOperationException.

        Specified by:
        supportsFailureStateUpdate in interface FailureProneEntity
        Overrides:
        supportsFailureStateUpdate in class FailureProneEntityImpl
        Returns:
        true if the FailureProneEntity.FailureState of this entity can be modified

      • isAllocated

        public boolean isAllocated()
        Description copied from interface: AllocatableEntity
        Returns true if this Entity is allocated, usually for sole use by another Entity).

        By default this entity is not allocated (ie: this method returns false).

        Specified by:
        isAllocated in interface AllocatableEntity
        Returns:
        true if this Entity is allocated
        See Also:
        AllocatableEntity.setAllocated(boolean)
